channel.title: Wat2Do — Upcoming events
channel.description: Upcoming events at the University of Waterloo

item.title: UWDBC Bake Sale
item.description:
Craving something sweet?
Stop by our Dragon Boat Bake Sale this Monday, Oct 27th from 9AM–4PM in the SLC! Brownies & Pumpkin Spice Cookies — only $2.50 each! Cash or card accepted Come grab a treat and support the team!💫

item.title: Anthropology Graduate School Workshop
item.description:
The Department of Anthropology will be hosting a workshop on Applying to Graduate School soon, and we’d appreciate your help in sharing and joining this opportunity.
🗓 Date: Monday, October 27 🕐 Time: 11:30 am – 1:00 pm 📍 Location: PAS 2030
The session will offer practical advice on preparing strong graduate school applications, selecting programs, and navigating the process successfully.

item.title: Divest Now
item.description:
UW DISCLOSED, AND IT’S EVEN WORSE THAN WE THOUGHT
At more than $200 million invested, the University of Waterloo ranks among the worst university offenders of complicity in the genocide.
The students forced UW to drop Technion, and we will force the Board of Butchers to divest.
🚨 TAKE ACTION NOW 🚨 ALL OUT OCTOBER 27th: DIVEST OR WE’LL DISMANTLE
Join us on Monday, October 27th to demand divestment and a complete end to UWaterloo’s complicity in genocide and occupation.
The students demand divestment now, and we will not rest until UW divests every last dollar they have in companies aiding the Zionist entity, until UW ceases all support for genocide and occupation and until total liberation and return.

item.title: SVPRO & Hot Chocolate
item.description: Next Monday the Sexual Violence Prevention and Response Office (SVPRO) will be joining us for the first hour of our meeting to talk about their role on campus, sexual safety, and resources available to us. SVPRO is the support system for those who have experienced sexual violence on campus and they also work to prevent it through training and awareness initiatives. You may be familiar with their 'consent week' events or 'red zone' awareness campaign (if not, this is a great time to learn about that). This is also an opportunity to ask questions or pass on feedback you might have for the university related to this topic. Also, hot chocolate will be served!! With marshmallows!! And whipped cream!! Yay!!

item.title: Pumpkin Carving
item.description:
Boo, Warriors! Spooky season is here 👻 Come out to the ESS Lounge and join us on October 27 for Pumpkin Carving from 6-8 p.m. Want to carve alone or in a group? No problem! Only one person needs to sign up. 🍂
Sign up through the link in our bio using our linktree! Remember, signing up pre-orders your pumpkin(s) for you. We hope to see you there! 🎃

item.title: Lip Balm Keychain Workshop
item.description:
Only one of us is at the right place💯 There’s no better place to de-stress after midterms than UW Beauty Club’s Trick-or-Treat Yourself lip balm and charm event!
$12 for pizza, a drink, and a new accessorized lippie?? What a steal!
We hope to see you there ;)
#uwaterloo #uwaterloolife #beauty #uwbeautyclub #beautyclub #lippie #event #university

item.title: RAISE Book Club
item.description:
📚Join our chill, no-prep book club, open to everyone. We are about good vibes, casual convo, and light snacks! Come as you are and read if you want, no pressure, just de-stress and relax📚
📕Every Monday 📘6:00 - 7:00 pm 📙RAISE Office SLC 3207
#wusa #uwaterloo #wusaraise #raise #literacy #event #bookclub #library #books #reading #bookworm #uwaterlooraise #uw #uwraise #fun #raisebookclub

item.title: Bonfire
item.description: Hello!!! CWC will be having our Fall bonfire next Monday from 6:00 PM to 9:00 PM at Laurel Creek Firepit (near EV3)!!! We will be having s’mores (and a good time)!!!

item.title: Korean Language Learning Session
item.description: Our Fall 2025 language session schedule is here! 🌟 Check the calendar to find out when your favourite sessions are running. A few sessions are still TBD, so stay tuned on discord for updates. We’re also still recruiting tutors for certain languages – details on the poster! 🗣️ Apply through our linktree if interested 🔗

item.title: Suspects & Secrets: Murder Mystery Night
item.description:
🔎 THE EVENT OF THE SEASON IS HERE! 🔍
Join PsychSoc for Suspects & Secrets: Murder Mystery Night, an immersive, thrilling evening where you become the detective. 🕵️‍♀️
Expect a night of mystery, laughter, and teamwork as you crack the case alongside other sleuths. Bring your friends or come solo, you’ll be paired with fellow detectives ready to solve the ultimate mystery! 🧩
📅 Monday, October 27 🕕 6:00–9:00 PM 📍 PAS 1241 🔗 Register using link in bio
Mystery. Suspense. Secrets. Free food!
You don’t want to miss the most thrilling night of the term. 👀
#mystery #murdermystery #event #unilife #student #uni #uwaterloo #psychology #detective

item.title: Standup Night
item.description: Take a break from midterms and come enjoy a comedy show on campus! This is a booked show.

item.title: Prod Night - Halloween Issue
item.description: 159.3, fresh off the presses! (Reenactment, not actually how we get our issues.) Come get them now! Oh, wait, what's that? No prod night in two weeks?! I need to wait an extra one?!!! Noooo!!!!! Next prod night on October 27th, 6:30PM, QNC 1502. Halloween issue!!!!!!! Be there :3

item.title: The Spirituality of Money
item.description:
💰✨ What does money have to do with spirituality? Join us for an insightful talk with Dr. Rikin Patel on The Spirituality of Money. Discover how ancient wisdom can guide us in balancing wealth, purpose, and well-being in today’s world.
📅 Monday, October 27th 🕖 7:00 PM 📍 Schlegel Building – SB106
✨ Free refreshments provided 🎁 Chance to win 1 of 2 $25 gift cards
Don’t miss this opportunity to explore a fresh perspective on wealth and life’s deeper values 🌱

item.title: Trivia Night
item.description:
We’re throwing a Trivia Night ‼️🎲
Bring your friends on October 27th at 7:00 PM at the Grad House to show off your trivia skills for a chance to win a prize! 🏆
All funds are going directly back to our team as a fundraiser! 💵
Register with the link in our bio! 🎟️

item.title: World Series Watch Party
item.description:
⚾ Blue Jays vs. Dodgers World Series Watch Parties! ⚾
The Toronto Blue Jays are taking on the LA Dodgers in the World Series — and we’re bringing every game to campus on the big screen! 💥
📅 Game Dates:
Oct 24 • Oct 25 • Oct 27 • Oct 28 🕗 8 PM 📍 SLC Great Hall
💙 Show up in your blue + white or Blue Jays gear and help fill the Great Hall with team spirit!
Grab your friends, bring the hype, and get ready for an unforgettable week of baseball, big plays, and campus energy! 🔥
Link in bio for details.

item.title: Candlelit Liturgy
item.description: Hi Everyone! We have a second candlelit liturgy happening next Monday, October 27th 🕯️ We hope you can all come and take the blessing of the liturgy with us ❤️🙏

item.title: Fall 2025 Clinics - Setting
item.description: Volleyball clinics for UW students! 🏐🔥 Want a safe space to improve specific skills like setting and defence?💪 Then come to our next skills clinics! See schedule for details. 🗓️

item.title: Sweet Lou's Fundraiser
item.description: Got a sweet tooth? 🍪 Stop by United College from 11am–4pm on Tuesday for Bridge to Campus UW’s Sweet Lou’s Fundraiser! Cookies are just $2.50 each — grab a treat and make your day a little sweeter 💛 Cash or e-transfer accepted! #uwaterloo #uw #bridgetocampus #fundraiser

item.title: Building with MCP
item.description:
Join @techplusuw and @claudeuwaterloo for Building with Model Context Protocol (MCP) - a hands-on session to learn how MCP works and start building your own after seeing one in action with Alexander Notov from Anthropic!
Bring: your laptop, charger, and @claudeai account Get: snacks and drinks 🧋
📅 Tuesday, Oct 28 ⏰ 2:15-4:15 pm 📍 DWE 3516 ➡️ Link in bio to sign up.

item.title: General Meeting
item.description:
🔥 This month’s general meeting is going to be (a bon)fire!
🌭 Take your mandatory rest period from midterm season to warm up to your fellow aviators with snacks and chats
✈️ Fly by Columbia Lake Fire Pit 1 this Tuesday, October 28th anytime between 1700-1930L
Bonfire bonding & UWAS updates Everyone’s welcome Swipe for map

item.title: Pumpkin Carving
item.description:
It’s carving season! Join ERSSA and KISS for a cozy, crafty night of pumpkin carving, snacks, and spooky vibes.🍂🎃👻
We'll provide pumpkins, tools and snacks, and we'll be in the ESS lounge (EV1 138) from 5:30 to 7:00 p.m. on Tuesday, October 28th! Everyone is welcomed to join.
PS. We'll be in costume, so get spooky and wear yours too🧟‍♀️🧛🏻‍♀️🧝🏻‍♀️🧙‍♀️

item.title: Wellness Campfire
item.description:
Week 9 is here — get ready for some exciting events!👀
WELLNESS CAMPFIRE🔥 🪵 Midterms all done? Come destress and socialize with friends! We’ve got hot dogs and smores! 📆 Tuesday, October 28th ⏰ 5:30 - 7:00 PM 📍Columbia Lake Firepit 1 ‼️ Please dress for the weather

item.title: Halloween Showdown
item.description: Step right up and test your skills in a spooky showdown! Cats, bats, ghosts, and creepy crawlies wait for you to build a team in this singles point buy tournament. A spooky Cyndaquil plush will be awarded to the winner! Not confident on which teams are tricks or treats? Sample teams will be provided on our discord or on the day of if need be! The list of available Pokemon can be found on the second slide or on our Discord. The format will be nat dex singles with bans on megas and Z moves. Tera will also be allowed! 7 points are allowed for you to budget and build your team. Join our Discord or DM us on insta for more details.

item.title: A Spooky Movie Night
item.description: It's Halloween at LASA 🎃! Join us for a spooktacular movie night, where the best costume wins a prize 🏆! Cast your vote for the scariest movie to watch 👻. Which scary movie should we watch 🫣👻??

item.title: Coraline Movie Night
item.description: 🎬🕸️ Get ready for a spooky movie night! 👻 Join WiSTEM to watch Coraline with free pizza and snacks! 🍕✨ 📅 October 28 🕕 6–8 PM 📍 MC 1085 Register using the link in our bio! 💜

item.title: Voices for Rights: A Human Rights Panel
item.description: Voices for Rights: A Human Rights Panel 🌍 Join us on October 28th, 6 PM – 8 PM at United College Alumni Hall (Room 201A) for an insightful discussion with human rights professionals! Hear about their experiences working to protect children’s rights and get your questions answered. Don’t miss this chance to learn, engage, and be inspired! LINK IN BIO 💙✨

item.title: STC After Dark
item.description:
There’s been a MURDER in STC… and the KILLER is still among US! 🕵️‍♂️🩸COME FIND OUT WHO DID IT? Join us for a night of chilling SUSPENSE, SNACKS, GAMES and PRIZES. Will you solve the case before the clock strikes midnight? 👀👻
🔗SIGN UP WITH YOUR TEAM WITH THE LINK IN OUR BIO
📆Date: October 28 ⏰Time: 6 PM - 9 PM 📍Location: STC 0060
#Halloween #UWATNA #UWATNADoesItBest #STCAfterDark

item.title: Ward of Nightmares
item.description: Get excited for OCC’s famous Haunted House happening on Oct 28th and 29th from 6-8pm in SLC Lower Flex Space! 👻🎃 Theme: Ward of Nightmares. You don’t want to miss out on this one - Are you brave enough to enter? 🫣🫣 Can you handle the terror that awaits? Join for scary live actors, sound effects and spooky decorations!

item.title: Midterm Destress Event
item.description:
‼️RECAP: Coaching Actuaries Tutorial ‼️
📢Thank you to all of the club members who joined us for an evening of learning about how Coaching Actuaries can help you with exam prep! Coaching Actuaries is a great resource to help you study, with structured materials, quizzes, and practice exams to guide you every step of the way. Whether you're just getting started or looking for extra practice, it’s a great tool to have.
💰We have a discount code! Save up to 70% off on your Coaching Actuaries subscription using our discount rates. Just send us a DM or email us to get the code!
📌 Don’t forget to come join us next week for our Midterm Destress event on Tuesday Oct 28 from 6 - 8pm in MC 4042 for a cozy evening of fun and games away from the stress of midterms.

item.title: Show & Tell Night
item.description: SSA is hosting a Show and Tell!🌟We invite members of the sangat to come prepared to share something that connects back to Sikhi. Your item can be anything — a book, a specific bhangti, a YouTube video, a SoundCloud track, an artifact, or anything else meaningful to you. We encourage you to share your item and explain its significance to you and your Sikhi journey, so that everyone can learn and grow together. After Show and Tell, join us for Games Night!

item.title: AI in Quantitative Finance
item.description:
not sure how to get started with quant finance? 😖
come to DSC × FARMSA: Al in Quantitative Finance and gain valuable insights about quant specifics- including a workshop going over how to build your own asset prediction model! 📈🧑‍💻
don’t forget... FREE pizza and bubble tea for all participants! 😋🍕🧋
📅 October 28 | 7-8 PM 📍QNC 1502

item.title: Projects Program 3.0 Kickoff
item.description:
🚀 Projects Program 3.0 Kickoff!
The Projects Program is back and better than ever!
🤝 Looking to gain hands-on experience, collaborate with a team, or learn from an experienced mentor? This is your opportunity to work on exciting CS projects this term and make meaningful connections with like-minded peers.
💡 Whether you’re passionate about web development, AI, mobile apps, or everything in between, this is your chance to take an idea from concept to creation while building your skills and expanding your network.
🎬 Join us for the Kickoff Event—form your team, find a mentor and start your project journey! 🗓️ Date: October 28, 2025 @ 7-9 PM 📍 Location: EIT 1015 Selected applicants will be notified by: (TBD)
Sign up now through the link in our bio! Deadline: 🔹 Mentees: October 21, 11:59 PM (signup form will be posted soon!) 🔹 Mentors: October 23, 11:59 PM

item.title: Men's Group Bowling
item.description: Hey guys!👋 Hope you guys are doing well during 👨‍🎓midterm season📚. We congratulate you all for making it this far!🎉 It is also the FIRST OFFICIAL MEN'S GROUP!! And we wanted to celebrate it by taking a break from midterms and going BOWLING🎳! We hope you guys take a break and come out! Bring your friends too! Sign-up is in our Linktree! Or through this link: https://forms.gle/9rmHGv4j56kKfJK59 ⌛Time: 7:30pm 📍Location: Splitsville Waterloo (341 Marsland Dr)

item.title: World Series Watch Party
item.description:

The Toronto Blue Jays are taking on the LA Dodgers in the World Series — and we’re bringing every game to campus on the big screen! 💥

Oct 24 • Oct 25 • Oct 27 • Oct 28 🕗 8 PM 📍 SLC Great Hall

Grab your friends, bring the hype, and get ready for an unforgettable week of baseball, big plays, and campus energy! 🔥

item.title: Future City Hackathon
item.description:
🌇 Want to shape the future cities?
Join the Future City Hackathon sponsored by Waterloo Future Cities Institute and Eleven Labs! This competition challenges you to build AI tools and solutions for community impact.
You can win $250 CAD gift cards and, food and drinks will be provided on the Hackathon day! To add, there will be career talks with industry experts from Google, NVIDIA, and more!
📅 Dates: Wednesday October 22nd (Remote) Sunday October 26th, (In-Person) and Wednesday October 29th (Remote)
📍Location: Davis Centre (DC) 1350
To sign up and more information: Check the link in our bio!

item.title: Sweet Lou's Cookie Sale
item.description:
Come join us for our Sweet Lou’s cookie sale this Wednesday 🍪‼️ Whether you’d like 1, 2, 6, or 12 cookies - we’ve got you covered! Keep reading for a FREE COOKIE?!! 🤗
💻 Pre-order before Tuesday, October 28th at 12 PM using the link in our bio to guarantee your cookies!
Event Info: 🗓️ Wednesday October 29th 💲$3.00 per cookie! Swipe for bundle pricing 📍Pickup at SLC from 10am-4pm
Enter our raffle to win a FREE cookie!! 🆓🍪 1. Make sure you are following us 2. Tag 3 friends in this comment section to be entered into the raffle (until Tuesday, October 28th 6 PM) 3. We will contact our lucky winner on Tuesday Night 🥳

item.title: What Were You Wearing?
item.description: Stop by this powerful exhibit hosted by the Sexual Violence Prevention and Respond Office on Wednesday and Thursday next week!

item.title: Taiyaki Pop Up
item.description:
We’re bringing the heat with freshly made TAIYAKI !! 🔥🐟
Golden, crispy, and filled with sweet goodness — grab yours for just $3.50 each, or get 2 for only $6!
🗓️Wednesday, October 29th ⏰ 11am-3pm 📍SLC Marketplace
Don’t miss out — come early before we sell out and treat yourself !
🌟Sponsored by K-Good Mart located at 363 King St N

item.title: Mandarin Language Learning Session
item.description: Our Fall 2025 language session schedule is here! 🌟 Check the calendar to find out when your favourite sessions are running. A few sessions are still TBD, so stay tuned on discord for updates. We’re also still recruiting tutors for certain languages – details on the poster! 🗣️ Apply through our linktree if interested 🔗

item.title: Matryoshka Doll Painting
item.description:
Calling all painters! Come de-stress from exam season by joining our matryoshka doll painting event! 🪆
Learn about the history of these iconic nesting dolls while designing your own beautiful set to take home. 🎨👨‍🎨
Open to all, bring a friend, your creativity, and good vibes! See you Wednesday, October 29.
Registration is mandatory‼️
Limited amount of dolls, so make sure you RSVP before sign-up closes on Oct 24.
Link in bio!

item.title: Student-Prof Night
item.description: PLEASE WEAR COSTUMES IF YOU HAVE THEM I AM BEING ASKED TO SAY THIS!! PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE WEAR THEM!!

item.title: Street·o·logy
item.description: Jane Street is hosting a virtual info session with insights on navigating the recruiting process! They'll share practical advice and best practices for managing timelines, deadlines, and offers to help you approach your job search with confidence. While this session will be especially beneficial for underclassmen beginning their internship search, the guidance applies to anyone pursuing internships or full-time positions. Sign up to gain useful perspectives that can make a difference in your approach to recruiting. Wednesday, October 29 6:00pm - 7:30pm ET Zoom details will be shared upon participation confirmation!

item.title: Council 3
item.description:
Week 9 is here — get ready for some exciting events!👀
COUNCIL 3🗣️ 🔧 It’s the third council of the term! Come to hear updates, share your voice, get involved, and free food! 📆 Wednesday, October 29th. ⏰ 6 - 9 PM 📍E7-5343

item.title: Balkan Bonfire
item.description: Get ready for a cozy night by the fire! Join us at Columbia Lake (Firepit 1) on October 29th at 6:00pm for snacks, drinks, games and good vibes. See you there!!

item.title: Halo-Halo-Ween
item.description:
🎃 Get ready for HALO-HALO-WEEN! 👻 Join us for a spooktacular night of Filipino culture, costumes, and sweet treats. Featuring Halo-Halo, karaoke, board games, and FSA Bingo! 🇵🇭✨
🗓️ Wednesday, October 29 ⏰ 6-9 PM 📍 SCH 228
🍧 HALO-HALO for Sale! $5 if you RSVP through the link in our bio, or $7 at the door 🚪 (while supplies last)
🏆 COSTUME CONTEST! Come dressed in your best costume for a chance to win exciting prizes! Judging begins at 8 PM, so bring your A-game 👀
🛍️ We’re teaming up with Love, Czerynne who will be selling handmade keychains: 1 for $10 or 2 for $15! Perfect for a cute keepsake or gift 🎁
🍬 Extras: ✨ F25 Discount Cards for $3
🔗 RSVP now through the link in our bio. See you there for a frightfully fun night! 👻🎉

item.title: Ward of Nightmares
item.description: Get excited for OCC’s famous Haunted House happening on Oct 28th and 29th from 6-8pm in SLC Lower Flex Space! 👻🎃 Theme: Ward of Nightmares. You don’t want to miss out on this one - Are you brave enough to enter? 🫣🫣 Can you handle the terror that awaits? Join for scary live actors, sound effects and spooky decorations!

item.title: Halloween Bonfire Night
item.description: 🔮🎃Gather ‘round the fire for a night of ghost stories, snacks and spooky history! Join us at Laurel Creek Firepit for our Halloween Campfire on Wednesday October 29th and 6:00pm!💀🕯️ Join us for some treats & spooky stories!

item.title: Care Packages For The Homeless
item.description:
Salaam Everyone,
TMA UW-WLU, TMA Guelph, and Who is Hussain are so excited to announce our first ever Care Packages for the Homeless Event. Join us as we gather as a community and build care packages for the nearby homeless shelter in Waterloo (Sanguen Health Center)‼️
🗓️ Wednesday October 29 ⏰ 7:15pm 📍 St. Jerome’s University (across from SLC over the bridge) in Room SJ2 2003.
🥤Drinks and refreshements will served to all volunteers
✅ RSVP through the polls that will be posted on Instagram/ WhatsApp soon!
IA we hope to see you all there🙏

item.title: Stem Cell Drive
item.description: Trick-or-treat yourself to a good deed🎃👻 Join us on OCTOBER 30th for our Halloween Stem Cell Drive — one small swab can mean a lifetime for someone else🧬 Pop by for some information on stem cells and Halloween treats!

item.description: Stop by this powerful exhibit hosted by the Sexual Violence Prevention and Respond Office on Wednesday and Thursday next week!

item.title: Therapy Dogs Event
item.description: woof woof woof is about to come from mc 3rd floor!! Take a mental health break with us and join us on Thursday, October 30 to wind down with some therapy dogs 🦴 🐾 P.S. Scroll to meet the dogs! 🐕

item.title: Women of Waterloo Halloween Event
item.description:
Join UW WiSTEM and other women+ clubs on campus for an amazing Halloween event, happening October 30th at 5:30pm in the E7 Atrium! 🎃👻
Join us for: 🧡pizza 🖤costume contest 🧡Halloween jigsaw puzzle 🖤 Headbandz 🧡Halloween mini games
There will be great prizes, great company and lots of Halloween fun! Sign up through link in bio:))

item.title: Halloween Practice + Pumpkin Painting
item.description: 👻 Halloween practice + pumpkin painting night! 🎃 Come paddle and paint with us this Halloween! 🧛‍♀️ Costume Practice: Oct 30 | 5:30–7 PM | Warrior Zone 🎨 Pumpkin Painting: 7:30–9 PM | MC 4021 For pumpkin painting, send $10 to katie.g.quigley@gmail.com by Oct 27 @ 7 PM so we can get you a pumpkin! All materials will be provided! Pumpkin painting is open to all — bring your friends #halloween #uwbdc #pumpkinpainting

item.title: Zero to Hero Workshop
item.description: Join @wataiteam’s workshop on Thursday for a live Claude Code demo, merch, and FREE Claude Pro 😎 When: 6-8pm on Thursday Oct 30th Where: E7, 2nd floor IDEAS Clinic No need to sign up - just stop by!

item.title: Discussion Night
item.description:
We are excited to announce our next event of the term, a philosophy discussion night in collaboration with the Wilfrid Laurier University Philosophy Club! The event will begin at 6pm with 30 minutes of philosophy themed games and icebreakers. From 6:30-8:30pm, we will break into groups to discuss philosophy questions.
The event is open to everyone of all majors/experience levels, and all topics or terminology will be briefly explained before each discussion begins to ensure everyone is on the same page.
WHEN: Thursday, October 30th 6pm-8:30pm WHERE: Laurier Campus, ARTS 2C17 (Arts C wing C)
As the discussion night will be held at Laurier University, we will post detailed instructions for how to get there before the event. The WLU interactive map can be found in our linktree.
If you would like to submit a discussion topic question ahead of time, you can do so through the form in our linktree.
We hope to see you there!

item.title: Pumpkin Carving
item.description:
🎃 Pumpkinn & Thrill: A Spooky Carving Night! 👻
Get ready for a night of creativity and chills as we carve our way into Halloween! ✨ Join us on October 30th from 6–8 PM for a pumpkin carving event with a thrilling twist. 🎨🕸️
Come dressed in your Halloweenest costume 🧛‍♀️🧙‍♂️ and show off your carving skills (or just your spooky vibes)! Whether you’re a pro with the carving knife or a first-time pumpkin artist, this event is open to all! 🙌
🕕 Date & Time: October 30th @ 6–8 PM 📍 Location: SLC Lower Flex Hall
🎃 Disclaimer: Pumpkins and carving tools are available while supplies last, so make sure to arrive early! ⏰
🔗 Click the link in our bio to learn more — and get ready for a night full of pumpkins, costumes, and thrills! 💀✨

item.title: Games Night
item.description: Get ready for a night of games and good company at our Games Night on Thursday, October 30th from 6-8 PM in STC 3014!

item.title: Murder Mystery Dinner
item.description: Hey ENV! Join ESS for an amazing night of food, fun, and thrilling riddles at our annual murder mystery dinner in the EV3 atrium on October 30th. It's free for ENV students and dinner will be provided! Non-ENV students are welcome to join as well! 🎃 To register, visit the link in our Linktree.

item.title: Pumpkin Carving
item.description:
Week 9 is here — get ready for some exciting events!👀
PUMPKIN CARVING🎃 ✨ Halloween is coming! Need some spooky decor? Come and carve your own jack o lantern! Pumpkins and tools will be provided. 📆 Thursday, October 30th. ⏰ 6 - 8 PM 📍POETS

item.title: Prof Night
item.description: It’s almost PROF NIGHT TIMEEEEEEE! Join us on Thursday, October 30th from 6-9 PM at Huether Hotel (with CGSS AND BSA) for some pool, yapping with friends and profs, and some amazing food and drinks 🎃🍻 Since it’ll be around Halloween, put on a costume! (maybe even dress up as the orgo midterm or a Crowdmark notification, truly nothing scarier than that) 😱 See you there (or else.... 👻)!

item.title: Hot Takes
item.description:
Hot Takes 🔥
Got something to say? Come share your bold opinions and enjoy some hot shai with us!
📆Date: Thursday Oct 30th
⏰Time: 6:30 PM
📍Location: RCH 301
#sudan #southsudan #wlu #uw #hottakes
Bring your friends, share your bold opinions, and enjoy some snacks!

item.title: The Light of Istikhara
item.description: 📣 Assalamu Alaykum MSA! Join us for our upcoming education event where Ustadh Basim Salim will be discussing the topic of Istikhara. You don’t want to miss this one! 🫵 Food will be served. Sign up is required- use the link in our bio!

item.title: Escape Room
item.description:
ready to get into the halloween spirit? 🎃👻
DSC’s first-ever ESCAPE ROOM is here– spooky puzzles, snacks, and prizes await… 😈🧩
🗓️ October 30 | 7–9PM 📍 starts in MC 2066 💻 bring your laptop!
there will be snacks, candy, cookies, and prizes for the winning team 😋🍪🏆
👥 teams of 3–4 (no worries if you don’t have one yet– you can form one at the event!) 💸 all participants must be DSC members (membership can be paid at the start!)
so grab your friends, solve some puzzles, and see if you can escape before the time runs out!!!⏳🙈
rsvp form in our linktree 🔗

item.title: Praise & Prayer
item.description: Come join us on Thursday, Oct 30 for a time of prayer and worship alongside friends from Grebel! We will be meeting in AL 105 from 7-8pm. We hope to see you there!

item.title: Japanese Language Learning Session
item.description: Our Fall 2025 language session schedule is here! 🌟 Check the calendar to find out when your favourite sessions are running. A few sessions are still TBD, so stay tuned on discord for updates. We’re also still recruiting tutors for certain languages – details on the poster! 🗣️ Apply through our linktree if interested 🔗

item.title: Halloween Climb
item.description: 🎃 Halloween Climb is here! 👻 Join us next week on Thursday, October 30 for a night of fun costumes, and free candy while you crush some frightfully fun problems at GRRW’s Boulder Night! If you bring a costume, you might get featured in our recap video 👀 Did we mention free candy? That’s there too! Please note that the GRR and PAC meetups are switched next week! PAC on Wednesday 7:30-9:00 PM and GRRW on Thursday from 7:00-9:00 PM

item.title: Bible Study
item.description: Since we live by the Spirit, let us keep in step with the Spirit.” — Galatians 5:25 NIV Join us next Thursday (October 30th, 2025) for an evening of reflection and renewal. Together we will explore what it means to truly know the Holy Spirit and walk in alignment with God’s will as youth. Through scripture, discussion, and fellowship, we will learn to follow His guidance in every step of our journey!

item.title: Halloween Night Hike
item.description: 🎃 HALLOWEEN NIGHT HIKE! 🎃 Join us on October 30th for a Halloween night hike! Wear your costumes and meet us on the Walter Bean Trail! 🌟 No membership required 🌟 Headlamps provided 🌟 Wear your costumes! 🗓️ Thursday Oct 30 🕘 8:30 PM 🏞️ Walter Bean Trail

item.title: Raa Raa — Halloween Bash
item.description: Join us for Raa Raa Halloween Bash on Oct 30 at Dallas Nightclub, Kitchener. Registration required, $20 entry!

item.title: Trick or Treat
item.description: 🎃 Trick or Treat at South Campus Hall! 🍬 Stop by the Writing and Communication Centre this Halloween for sweet treats and spooky vibes! 👻 📍 Find us on second floor, room 219 --> just follow the signs! 🕐 October 31 | During the day Costumes optional, candy guaranteed. 🍭

item.title: Brown Bag Talk
item.description:
🎓 Join us for our next Brown Bag Talk! Bioarchaeological and Archaeological Approaches to Adolescence: A Case Study from 19th to 20th Century England 🗣️ Speaker: Dana Thacher, Western University 📅 Date: Friday, October 31, 2025 🕚 Time: 11:00 am – 1:00 pm 📍 Location: PAS 2030
All are welcome — come learn and connect!

item.title: Halloween Palm Pals Sale
item.description:
PALM PALS ARE BACK!!
📅 October 31 ⏰ 12:30 📍SLC (outside multi purpose room) A share of the proceeds will be donated to the Kitchener-Waterloo Humane Society!

item.title: Spanish Language Learning Session
item.description: Our Fall 2025 language session schedule is here! 🌟 Check the calendar to find out when your favourite sessions are running. A few sessions are still TBD, so stay tuned on discord for updates. We’re also still recruiting tutors for certain languages – details on the poster! 🗣️ Apply through our linktree if interested 🔗

item.title: Halloween 5K Run
item.description:
Get ready for our Halloween 5K Run happening on October 31st at 6PM! 👻 🎃 🍫 Join us for a night of thrilling fun in a run!
📍 CIF, near the beach volleyball courts
Come dressed in your BEST costume for a chance to win our costume competition 👀🕷️🌟 Whether you’re running or dancing your way to the finish line, we want to see you there!
#uwaterloo #runningclub #spookyszn

item.title: UWDC x Origins Combo Collab
item.description:
Get ready for one of our most epic collabs yet! UW Dance Company x Origins is bringing you two back-to-back combo classes on Saturday, November 1st from 4:00 pm–7:00pm in PAC Studio 1! Join us for an Open combo with Kelsey from UWDC and a Hip Hop combo with Mikayla from Origins. 🤩🔥
Everyone is welcome! Fill out the pre-registration form linked in our bio to register before the start of class 🕺$15 for non-members and $10 for team members.
Don’t miss this amazing collab! We can’t wait to see you there! 💛🖤🧡 #dance #dancersofinsta #explore #uwaterloo #uwdancecompany #originsdancecompany

item.title: Anicafe
item.description: Attention everyone it’s the event you’ve all been waiting for… Anicafe!!! Come join us November 1st for our Animusic Ensembles Maid Cafe 🥳 There will live music, food, drinks, and our very own merch!! Show up in cosplay for a free drink 🍹 Event is free entry! 📆 November 1, 2025 ⏰ 6pm 📍STC 1123 (former Bombshelter Pub) And a big thanks to @sharpenyourforks for the lovely poster art 🥰

item.title: Raat Ruhaani
item.description:
✨ Raat Ruhaani ✨
We’re back with another Qawwali Night — Step into a mesmerizing evening of soulful Qawwali, candlelit charm, and heartfelt harmony. 🎶
Let the music, poetry, and rhythm of the night draw you in as we celebrate art, culture, and togetherness — with delicious food to complete the experience. 🍛🕯️
📅 November 1, 2025 🕡 6:30 PM 📍 SLC Black & Gold Room 🎟️ Tickets in bio

item.title: Bhool Bhulaiyaa
item.description:
Warming up the dance floor for Bhool Bhulaiyaa!💃🏽🎃 Bhool Bhulaiyaa, the craziest Halloween Bollywood night is a week away and tickets are flying. Don’t be the friend who misses out.
🎟️ Tickets are in the link in our bio! Get them now!
#gujarati #bollwood #indian #halloween #halloweenideas #fyp #party #laurier #wilfridlaurieruniversity #universityofwaterloo #brown #bollywoodnight

item.title: Slime Time
item.description:
Week 9 is here — get ready for some exciting events!👀
SLIME TIME🫳 😌 Come join us for a fun slime-making session! A tutorial and all supplies will be provided — so bring your creativity and prepare to get messy! 📆 Sunday, November 2nd. ⏰ 5:30 - 7:30 PM 📍POETS 🔗 bit.ly/F25SlimeTime ‼️ Pick up your shrinky dinks from the keychain event!

item.title: Fall 2025 League
item.description: Sign up now for our Fall 2025 League! 6 weeks of curling, all skill levels welcome! Membership is $90. Use the link in our bio to fill out the Google Form and Sign Up on Athletics (2 forms to fill out).

item.title: Nightmare at Rare
item.description: tickets are LIVE in our link in bio…👀 - - - #waterloo #asian #clubbing #reels #trend #halloween #abg us warming up for the best halloween clubbing event in waterloo

item.title: Community Meeting
item.description:
Hello theatre students!
We are planning to have a THPERF X TSU Theatre Community Meeting! This will be where you can kindly bring any and all of your questions, comments or concerns you may have about the THPERF program and classes. Then we, your TSU, will bring your input to our next meeting with the THPERF department, so everyone can have their input included.
Our THPERF X TSU Theatre Community Meeting will be held on Monday, November 3rd, from 1-2 pm in AL6, which can be found in the basement of the Arts Lecture Hall.
We’re looking forward to seeing you all!

item.title: Qawwali Night
item.description:
🎶 PSA is bringing back one of our most soulful traditions — Qawali Night! 🌙✨
Get ready for an unforgettable evening filled with music, culture, and emotion. Experience the magic of live qawali by @shahid_ali_khan_qawal where every beat connects hearts and every verse tells a story 💚
📍 Location: Victoria Park Pavilion 📅 Date: Monday, November 3rd ⏰ Time: 6:00 PM – 11:00 PM
🎟 Tickets: Early Bird – $29 Tier 1 – $35 Tier 2 – $39
Early Bird tickets are LIVE — grab yours before they’re gone! Link in bio 🇵🇰🔥

item.title: Scare-Venture Hunt
item.description: Are you ready for Halloween? Or more specifically, a SCARE-VENTURE? Drop by the WiCS Study Room in DC 2331 from 7–8 PM to check-in your team and start your campus-wide scavenger hunt! Candy bags for all, and a sweet prize for the fastest team! Event ends at 8:30 PM. Each team member needs to register using the form linked in our bio! Teams can consist of 1-4 people.

item.title: Fall 2025 Clinics - Hitting
item.description: Volleyball clinics for UW students! 🏐🔥 Want a safe space to improve specific skills like setting and defence?💪 Then come to our next skills clinics! See schedule for details. 🗓️

item.title: Finding the Balance in Sustainable Menstruation
item.description:
🌍 Sustainability goes beyond recycling bins; it's also about how we care for our bodies and communities.
Join us in exploring how sustainability, period poverty, and menstrual equity intersect in the next installment of the Menstrual Equity Series, "Finding the Balance in Sustainable Menstruation"!
💡Hosted by Karen Farley (they/their) Environmental researcher and recent master's graduate, Karen's findings led to the creation of "Period Pin", an online map connecting menstruators to over 2,000 product locations across Canada.
**Registration link in bio
📆 Tuesday, November 4th! 📍Online

item.title: SOFA Art Sale
item.description:
PICK UP THE PHONE! 📞 SOFA is hosting an art sale on November 4th and WE NEED VENDORS!
This is a great opportunity for anyone looking to sell their art and/or crafts. Apply through the *LINK IN OUR BIO*.
The sale will be hosted in the SLC Multi-Purpose Room.
This event is NOT exclusive to UW students, applications are open to all.
The deadline to apply is October 27th at 11:59. PLEASE ANSWER OUR CALL!! 🙏

item.title: WiE Career Fair
item.description: Join the WiE Career Fair on Nov 4, 2025, at SLC Black and Gold Room. Free registration required!

item.title: Pumpkin Spice & Thrifted Delights
item.description:
🍂🎃 Thrift finds + pumpkin spice? Name a better duo 👀
Get ready to sip, shop, and serve serious fall vibes at Pumpkin Spice & Thrifted Delights — your cozy campus thrift sale!
🛍️ Thursday, Nov 6 | 11AM–2PM 📍 SLC Multi-Purpose Room 💸 Everything under $10 — cash, debit & credit accepted!
Browse fab fall fits from @wusathrift and grab a FREE pumpkin spice cappuccino + donut while you shop ☕🍩
⚠️ WatCard required for complimentary refreshments. Refreshments are exclusive to Waterloo undergrads — while supplies last! 🎟️ Make sure to check in at the WUSA booth to get your treat ticket.
🎯 Tag a friend, save this post, and come through — you don’t wanna miss this fall drop!

item.title: LinkedIn Headshots
item.description:
Smile Arts Students 📸
Still need a professional headshot for your Linkedin or co-op applications?
🕒 Join the ASU on November 7th from 12pm to 3pm for free professional headshots!
📍 In the HLTH EXP building, go to the second floor using the stairs near Starbucks!
‼️ Spots are limited and based on a first come first serve basis, please sign up ASAP!
LINK IN BIO🧡

item.title: 3Peas: Performative Edition
item.description:
🍵 3Peas: Performative Edition 🎧
It’s time to romanticize volleyball. ✨ Join us for our Performative 3Peas Tournament on Friday, November 7th, where we’ll be serving performative energy both on and off the court. 🏐
📆 Date: Friday, November 7 ⏰ Time: 3:00 PM – 9:00 PM 🏫 Location: CIF Gyms 1 & 2 🎭 Theme: Performative 🎶 🏅 Prizes: Winning team of 6 + Best Dressed Team
👥 Sign up as: • A team of 3 (female-identifying members) • Or as an individual and get matched with a team!
✨ Tournament Divisions & Caps: • Level 1/2/3 Tournament: Level cap of 7 • Level 3/4/5 Tournament: Level cap of 12 • All competitors must be evaluated this term in Levels 1–5 • These are two separate women’s tournaments (Level 1/2/3 and Level 3/4/5)
🏐 Format: • Round Robins: Each trio plays 5–6 sets, randomly paired against other trios. • Finals: Top 2 teams (by sets won then point differential) each choose another trio to play with for finals.
👉 Sign-ups open this Friday at 3 PM — first come, first serve! Wait for your captain’s confirmation email before game day. 📍 Link in our Linktree!
So grab your tote, sip your matcha, open up Clash Royale, and get ready to soft-serve your heart out. ☁️🍵💿

item.title: Crown Conversations
item.description: Hi family! 👋🏾 Join BASE, LBIH (Lanterna Black Innovation Hub) and the Black Collective for “Crown Conversations”, a collaboration with their “Friday’s After 5”sessions at the EDI-R. We’ll be talking about everything to do with Black hair and belonging. Topics will include: hair-typing and its origins, texturism within the Black community, hair styling and products, plus a discussion to share personal journeys and routines! 🗓️ Friday, November 7th, 2025 ⏱️ 5-7:30 PM 📍East Campus 5 (EC5) -> Second floor -> Office of Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Anti-Racism (EDI-R) 🍕 There will be pizza and other light refreshments available. See you soon!

item.title: Shabbat Dinner
item.description: Plans for Friday night? We’ve got dinner covered 😉 Shabbat with Hillel x AEPi x Masa x Tailor Made — because challah and community just hit different. 🍷✨ Link to register in bio!

item.title: Charity Run & Walk
item.description:
You’re going to want to run to this registration form! 🏃
When the Outers Club meets the Run Club, GREAT things happen🙌
We’re hosting a charity run/hike through Columbia Hills and half of all proceeds will go toward Ontario Nature 🌿
Sweet prizes are up for grabs🏆
Registration is open now✅

item.title: Balance
item.description: 🎉The most anticipated ACS event is BACK💃🏾🕺🏽 We’re tipping the scales with Soca, Dancehall & Afrobeats all night long! Come with your crew and we hope you can find your BALANCE after the night done🔥✨ 📅 Saturday, Nov 8 | 9PM–2AM 📍 Up Lounge 🎧 DJ Cozy & DJ D 🎟️ Early Bird: $15 | Door: $20 🔞19+ 🔗 Early bird tickets out NOW!!! [link in bio]

item.title: Battle of the Jazz Bands
item.description: Its the event of the season! Come watch jazz bands from the University of Toronto, McMaster University and the University of Waterloo battle it out on the Hagey Hall Theater stage from 2:00-4:30 pm on November 9th. This will be our largest event yet and definitely the first of its kind. Bring everyone you know to attend this FREE concert.

item.description: Sign up now for our Fall 2025 League! 6 weeks of curling, all skill levels welcome! Membership is $90. Use the link in our bio to fill out the Google Form and Sign Up on Athletics (2 forms to fill out).

item.description: Volleyball clinics for UW students! 🏐🔥 Want a safe space to improve specific skills like setting and defence?💪 Then come to our next skills clinics! See schedule for details. 🗓️

item.title: Co-Op Workplace Simulation
item.description: Want to level up your co-op experience and impress your next employer? On October 22 join Velocity at the Co-op Workplace Simulation. This event is open to all students from any faculty or program. This is not just another workshop, it’s a dynamic simulation where you’ll role-play real-world scenarios using AI tools. You’ll step into the shoes of a co-op student working for an employer in any industry, spot a challenge, and learn how to bring your innovative solution to your employer - confidently and effectively. Register at the link in our bio!

item.title: GIS Day
item.description: 🌍✨ Celebrate GIS Day with us! Join the Waterloo Geography community in EV2-2002 on November 13th from 2:30–4:30PM for an afternoon of maps, stories, and exploration! Additionally, if you’re interested in sharing your journey, from personal experiences to professional research, submit your presentation idea through the link in our LinkTree (in our bio)! 🗺️💚 #GISDay #WAGS #Geography #UWaterlooGeo

item.title: Politics Without the Podium
item.description:
Bring a friend 👯‍♀️ and join MP Bardish Chagger and MPP Catherine Fife for an evening of open conversation at the Bomber on Nov 13.
💬 Connect with your local representatives, ask questions, and share your thoughts in a casual, community-focused setting.
👉 Link in bio to register!

item.title: Mocktail & Mingle
item.description:
Hi everyone!
Come unwind and connect with optometry and medical student at our Interprofessional Mocktails & Mingle Night on Wednesday, November 13th from 7–10 PM! It’s a great chance to socialize, enjoy some good food and drinks, and build connections across disciplines in a relaxed setting. Don’t miss it!
✨ Date: November 13 🕖 Time: 7:00–10:00 PM 📍School of Optometry
It is a free event, however, we do require sign-ups for RSVP purposes. Please sign-up by Nov 5, 2025 to secure your spot. See you all there!
Sign-up link in bio!

item.title: WiE Hackathon
item.description: Join us for a one-day hackathon designed to empower women and non-binary students in tech! Applications close November 5th at 11:59 PM. 📍E7 Faculty hall (7303) 📅 November 15th 🕒 8:00 AM - 7:00 PM Register through the link in bio!

item.title: IGNITE
item.description: At IGNITE, participants will be able to attend workshops that are designed to help students develop professional skills and gain insight to career pathways. UW ACE Chapter is also hosting a networking session with the firms like EY, MNP, RBC, and Definity. Please note that to attend IGNITE, participants must be registered as a delegate. Links to register are in our bio.

item.title: Waterloo Warriors vs. Badgers
item.description: Check out our official Fall 2025 schedule‼️ The Warriors are rolling through the season! 💛🖤 come cheer us on 📣 Home or away, we’re excited and ready to hit the ice 👊

item.title: Campus Cup Dodgeball Tournament
item.description: 🔥 CALLING ALL AHSSIES! 🔥 Think you’ve got the dodgeball skills to prove that Team Health reigns supreme? 🏆💪 Join us as we face off against other faculties in the first ever Campus Cup Dodgeball Tournament — a day full of friendly competition, and bragging rights. 🏐✨ ⚡ Spots are LIMITED and first-come, first-served, so don’t wait — sign up NOW to lock in your spot and your team shirt! 📅 Nov 15 | 12:30 PM – 9:30 PM | CIF Gyms 1 & 2 Let’s show everyone that Health = Hustle + Heart. 💚 👉 Scan the QR code or click the link in our bio to join Team Health today

item.title: Grad Ball
item.description:
Get ready for Class of 2026’s SAF Grad Ball on November 15th, 2025! 🍾
Tickets are now on sale on WUSA (link in bio) through October 21st - 28th. Once purchased, please fill out the google form to confirm your ticket (link in bio). 📝
For any questions, please DM or email safgradball@uwafsa.com
See you there! 💃🕺

item.title: STANK: Serve's Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition
item.description: 🥧 Prepare for a Feast of Fierce Volleyball! 🦃 As the leaves turn and the holiday spirit fills the air, it’s time for STANK: Serve’s Thanksgiving Annual N(v)olleyball Kompetition! Gather your team, bring your best plays, and get ready to serve up gratitude with spikes, digs, and fierce rallies. Let’s celebrate the season with some friendly competition and a full plate of fun! Event Details: 🏐 Date: Saturday, November 15th-16th (Overnight) ⏰ Time: 8pm to 8am 📍 Location: PAC Main Gym + Small Gym 🍂 Team Sign-Up Form your crew of 6 to 9 players (only UWaterloo students with a valid athletics membership or alumni with a day pass) and choose your division: semi-competitive or competitive. Co-ed rules apply: all teams must have at least 2 female-identifying players on the court at all times. (Note: A female libero is required to serve for a middle.) ⚠️ NEW Semi-Comp Sign-Up Rules (Read Carefully!) To keep play balanced and fair this season: - Any male-identifying player rated Level 5 or of Level 5 ability must set or lib on a semi-comp team. - If you attended UW prior to the 5-level system (graduated before Fall 2023), the same rule applies if you were rated Level 4. - Spring levels are not included in this consideration. - If there’s any confusion, please reach out to an exec for clarification. - If your team has a Level 5 male player signed up for semi-comp, contact an exec to verify the validity of your team. - Players who are not evaluated this term may be removed from your team on the day of or asked to set/lib if necessary. 💰 Pricing Regular (still fresh out of the coop): Register by Nov 3rd for $200 Both the form and payment must be completed by Nov 3rd @ 11:59pm. 📝 How to Register Make your payment: https://warrior.uwaterloo.ca/Program/GetProgramDetails?courseId=e7072bd1-0754-4e99-9fbe-04a18228cfe1 Fill out the form: https://forms.office.com/r/twpLDkzmhD @everyone 🏐 Let’s spice up the season, rally together, and make this Thanksgiving one to remember!
